meanings.definition: A day taken off work due to illness.
meanings.sent1: She took a sickie yesterday because she had a bad cold.
meanings.sent2: He used up all his sick days for the year after taking a sickie last month.
meanings.sent3: The boss was not happy when he found out about the last-minute sickie.
meanings.sent4: Taking a sickie can sometimes lead to falling behind on work tasks.
meanings.sent5: The bright red nose was a clear sign she needed to take a sickie.

meanings.sent1: She looked pale and sickie, so her friends insisted she go home.
meanings.sent2: After eating the expired food, he felt sickie for the rest of the day.
meanings.sent3: The sickie cat curled up in a warm blanket to rest.
meanings.sent4: The sickie feeling in his stomach made him regret eating the spicy food.
meanings.sent5: The sickie expression on her face showed she needed to lie down.

meanings.definition: A person who is ill or unwell.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed medicine to help the sickie recover faster.
meanings.sent2: The sickie in the hospital room was visited by friends and family.
meanings.sent3: The little sickie smiled weakly when given a get-well card.
meanings.sent4: The sickie's room was filled with get-well soon balloons.
meanings.sent5: The sickie's favorite soup was brought to them to help them feel better.
